Package camzup.core

Class MeshDirect

java.lang.Object
camzup.core.MeshDirect
public class MeshDirect extends Object
A variant of the Mesh class intended for use with JOGL. Coordinates, texture coordinates, normals and vertex colors are stored in float arrays. Indices are expected to form triangles. Intended for lower-level code work and performance-oriented display, rather than procedural generation.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    static final int
    COLOR_STRIDE
    The number of components per color in an array, 4.
    float[]
    colors
    Vertex colors array; uses a stride of 4.
    static final int
    COORD_STRIDE
    The number of components per coordinate in an array, 3.
    float[]
    coords
    Coordinates array; uses a stride of 3.
    static final int
    INDEX_STRIDE
    The number of indices per face in an array, 3.
    int[]
    indices
    Indices array; uses a stride of 3.
    static final int
    NORMAL_STRIDE
    The number of components per normal in an array, 3.
    float[]
    normals
    Normals array; uses a stride of 3.
    static final int
    TEX_COORD_STRIDE
    The number of components per texture coordinate in an array, 2.
    float[]
    texCoords
    Texture coordinates array; uses a stride of 2.

  • Field Details

    • colors

      public float[] colors
      Vertex colors array; uses a stride of 4.

    • coords

      public float[] coords
      Coordinates array; uses a stride of 3.

    • indices

      Indices array; uses a stride of 3.

    • normals

      public float[] normals
      Normals array; uses a stride of 3.

    • texCoords

      public float[] texCoords
      Texture coordinates array; uses a stride of 2.

    • COLOR_STRIDE

      public static final int COLOR_STRIDE
      The number of components per color in an array, 4.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • COORD_STRIDE

      public static final int COORD_STRIDE
      The number of components per coordinate in an array, 3. Should reflect the data structure in the shader that will receive the data, e.g., vec4s should use stride 4, vec3s should use stride 3.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • INDEX_STRIDE

      public static final int INDEX_STRIDE
      The number of indices per face in an array, 3.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • NORMAL_STRIDE

      public static final int NORMAL_STRIDE
      The number of components per normal in an array, 3.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • TEX_COORD_STRIDE

      public static final int TEX_COORD_STRIDE
      The number of components per texture coordinate in an array, 2. Should reflect the data structure in the shader that will receive the data, e.g., vec3s should use stride 3, vec2s should use stride 2.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • transformCoord

      public MeshDirect transformCoord(int i, float m00, float m01, float m02, float m03, float m10, float m11, float m12, float m13, float m20, float m21, float m22, float m23, float m30, float m31, float m32, float m33)
      Transforms a mesh coordinate at an index by a 4x4 matrix.
      Parameters:
      i - the index
      m00 - row 0, column 0
      m01 - row 0, column 1
      m02 - row 0, column 2
      m03 - row 0, column 3
      m10 - row 1, column 0
      m11 - row 1, column 1
      m12 - row 1, column 2
      m13 - row 1, column 3
      m20 - row 2, column 0
      m21 - row 2, column 1
      m22 - row 2, column 2
      m23 - row 2, column 3
      m30 - row 3, column 0
      m31 - row 3, column 1
      m32 - row 3, column 2
      m33 - row 3, column 3
      Returns:
      this mesh

    • transformCoord

      public MeshDirect transformCoord(int i, Mat3 m)
      Transforms a mesh coordinate at an index by a 3x3 matrix. Assumes the matrix holds a 2D affine transform.
      Parameters:
      i - the index
      m - the matrix
      Returns:
      this mesh

      Transforms the coordinates in a mesh by a 4x4 matrix.
      Parameters:
      m00 - row 0, column 0
      m01 - row 0, column 1
      m02 - row 0, column 2
      m03 - row 0, column 3
      m10 - row 1, column 0
      m11 - row 1, column 1
      m12 - row 1, column 2
      m13 - row 1, column 3
      m20 - row 2, column 0
      m21 - row 2, column 1
      m22 - row 2, column 2
      m23 - row 2, column 3
      m30 - row 3, column 0
      m31 - row 3, column 1
      m32 - row 3, column 2
      m33 - row 3, column 3
      Returns:
      this mesh
